titles.title: Long Plunged In Sorrow I Resign (easy unique t

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Long plunged in sorrow I resign My soul to that dear hand of Thine Without reserve or fear That hand shall wipe my streaming eyes Or into smiles of glad surprise Transform the falling tear{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}My sole possession is Thy love In earth beneath or heaven above I have no other store And though with fervent suit I pray And importune thee night and day I ask Thee nothing more{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The Cross - O ravishment and bliss How grateful e'en its anguish is Its bitterness how sweet There every sense and all the mind In all her faculties refined Taste happiness complete{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Self-love no grace in sorrow sees Consults her own peculiar ease 'Tis all the bliss she knows But nobler aims true love employ In self-denial is her joy In suffering her repose{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Sorrow and love go side by side Nor height nor depth can e'er divide Their heaven-appointed bands Those dear associates still are one Nor till the race of life is run Disjoin their wedded hands{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Thy choice and mine shall be the same Inspirer of that holy flame Which must forever blaze To take the cross and follow Thee Where love and duty lead shall be My portion and my praise{/lang-eng}
